Title: Mandela Rhodes Scholarship for African Students 2026 | Fully Funded
Description:
The Mandela Rhodes Scholarship 2026 is a fully funded opportunity for young African leaders to pursue postgraduate studies in South Africa. Covering tuition, accommodation, meals, and travel, this prestigious scholarship also includes a leadership development program. It focuses on education, reconciliation, entrepreneurship, and leadership, helping scholars grow intellectually and personally. This Mandela scholarship program empowers individuals to create positive change in their communities while upholding equality, human dignity, and social justice.
This scholarship in South Africa provides a life-changing experience through a structured leadership development program. Scholars participate in week-long residential workshops designed to enhance self-awareness, critical thinking, and innovation. The program builds a strong network of young African changemakers, fostering meaningful discussions on leadership and social impact. Recipients must enroll in a recognized South African university, ensuring access to world-class education while developing skills to lead and transform their societies.
The Mandela Rhodes Foundation, one of Nelson Mandela’s three official legacy organizations, was established in 2003 in partnership with the Rhodes Trust. It continues Mandela’s mission to nurture future African leaders by providing financial and leadership support. Through this scholarship, young visionaries gain opportunities to shape Africa’s future by embracing innovation, equality, and empowerment. Applicants passionate about making a difference in Africa are encouraged to apply and become part of this transformational journey.
Deadline: All interested candidates can apply till21 April 2025.
Eligibility: Open to citizens of any African country.Applicants must be between 19 and 29 years old at the time of application.Must have a strong academic record, typically above 70% or upper-second class Honours.The scholarship is for postgraduate studies (Honours or Master’s degrees) in South African universities.You can apply if you are completing your undergraduate degree this year, but you must have your degree by January 1, 2026.Must be able to study in English, as all South African universities use English as the medium of instruction.
Program Duration: Honours Degree Program-1 yearMaster’s Degree Program-2 years

Title: MEPI Tomorrow’s Leaders Program 2024-25 | Fully Funded
Description:
The Tomorrow’s Leaders Program, funded by the Department of State’s U.S.-Middle East Partnership Initiative (MEPI), provides fully funded scholarships for students in Egypt and Lebanon from economically deprived communities who reflect the cultural and regional diversity of the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). To provide participants with valuable knowledge and practical skills required for effective leadership, the Tomorrow’s Leaders Program has collaborated with the top American-style universities in Cairo and Beirut. Participants in the Tomorrow’s Leadership Program will get access to a dynamic community that provides a wide range of support systems such as mentorship and personal development programs.
By enrolling at prestigious liberal arts universities such as the American University of Beirut, the American University in Cairo, and the Lebanese American University through thisfully funded scholarship for international students, students will get a chance to develop critical thinking skills and enhance their capacity to come up with creative solutions to the problems faced by their communities, the MENA region, and the global community. Tomorrow’s Leaders will apply their academic knowledge to practical situations through engaging internships, civic engagement initiatives, and enrichment courses, along with their outstanding academic work.
Before thisinternational scholarshipfor undergraduate and graduate students starts, there will be upcoming information sessions by Tomorrow’s Leaders three university partners. These events will provide applicants with all the information they require to select the best school for them and prepare a compelling application for the Tomorrow’s Leaders Program. You will have a chance to interact with professionals of the Tomorrow’s Leaders Program team during these sessions. They will cover a wide range of topics, including eligibility criteria, necessary application materials, the numerous aspects of university life, and much more. Applicants will receive useful information about the many academic disciplines that are offered through this international scholarship program, campus safety, student clubs and athletics, and facilities on campus.
Undergraduate students will have the opportunity to pursue a semester studying abroad in the US, where they can interact with locals, get fully immersed in American culture, and expand their perspective on the world. After completing Fully Funded MEPI Tomorrow’s Leaders scholarship programs, participants will become part of a network of more than 1,000 program alumni who are leaders in the Middle East and North Africa region. The tuition fee for both undergraduate and graduate scholarships is waived off 100%, along with free accommodation, health insurance, entry visa, a monthly stipend for participating in Tomorrow’s Leaders activities, textbook allowance, a laptop, 2 round-trip air tickets to home country per year, access to career-oriented workshops, internship opportunities and getting mentorship from the university faculty. What are you waiting for? Apply now for this amazing fully funded scholarship program before the applications are closed.
Eligibility: Medical school students are not eligible to apply.IELTS and TOEFL test scores are not needed at the time of submitting the application. You will need them later on if you get selected after interview.S. citizens and U.S. legal permanent residents cannot apply.Applicants should have 80% marks in previous academic history.Candidates should belong to one of the countries mentioned below.Graduate applicants have to complete and submit two separate applications while apply to the American University of Beirut and the American University in Cairo. One will be Tomorrow’s Leaders Program graduate application and the other will be separate application to the partner institution.
Program Duration: 4 years of undergraduate and 2 years of graduate program.

Title: Fulbright Scholar Program for Pakistan 2025 in the USA | Fully Funded
Description:
The Fulbright Scholar Program for Pakistan 2025 is an exceptional opportunity for those who are interested in lectureship, post-doctoral research, or a combination of both. This Scholar program is afully funded scholarship programfor PHD scholars who are willing to make a prominent impact in their societies through their research. During their Fulbright scholarship program, the scholars will be doing research at U.S. colleges or universities. Moreover, this wonderful USEFP Fulbright opportunity allows one fully funded dependent of the selected candidate to come to the U.S. for free. So, this Fulbright Scholar Program in the USA will not be missed by the eligible candidates.
This year USEFP came up with a yearlongfully funded scholarship program in the USAfor the PHD scholars, professionals, and artists from all disciplines. The selected candidates of this Fulbright post-doc opportunity are simply expected to share the culture and norms of their society with the students, colleagues, and community groups in U.S. during their 12-month stay in the United States. Furthermore, the Fulbright Scholars are expected to go back to their home country and share their knowledge and experience of their stay in the U.S. with their own societies. Their knowledge from the college or university in the U.S. must be depicted from their significant development works back home.
The extraordinary chance to come to the U.S. for free and without IELTS/TOFEL or any other English proficiency test is a window of opportunity for those who are eager to make a change in the society through exchange of knowledge and research. Approximately 15 scholars will be selected for the year 2024. Out of these 15 selected scholars, 13 slots are for the faculty and the researchers who are in the early stages of their research work which is from 2-7 years. The remaining two slots in this fully funded Fulbright program are for senior scholars who are 8-15 years from the completion of their Ph.D. or terminal degree.
The United States Educational Foundation in Pakistan invites applications for the 2024 Fulbright Scholar program with a clear view of exchanging culture between both countries i.e. U.S. and Pakistan. For this, the candidate must have a clear perspective and well-prepared proposal about what they want to accomplish in the U.S. through their research and how it can benefit their Pakistani community. The program is a wonderful chance for Pakistani scholars to come forward for their community and do some remarkable developments in their fields. So, this year, the Fulbright scholarship for Ph.D. scholars and professionals is an opening for them to be a part of their country’s progress, and this opportunity, thus, is surely to be availed by the dedicated and deserving scholars.
Deadline: The last date to submit the application isSeptember 18, 2024.
Program Duration: The duration of the Fulbright scholarship in the USA is up to 12 months

Title: UP Commonwealth Scholarship in South Africa | Fully Funded
Description:
As a research-focused university, the University of Pretoria (UP) is offeringfully funded scholarshipsin South Africa for candidates who can significantly advance its research goals from Commonwealth countries (excluding South African students) as part of South Africa’s commitment to the Commonwealth Scholarship and Fellowship Plan. The UP Commonwealth Scholarship is being offered based on leadership skills and academic achievements.
UP has evolved into a vibrant academic community with faculty, staff, and students representing international societies and a variety of backgrounds and cultures. The goal of thisCommonwealth PhD scholarshipis to establish an environment that supports innovation and high-quality education and is well known for its outstanding academic programs, specially when it comes to its significant research endeavors.
UP Doctoral Commonwealth Scholarship 2024-25 is offering a variety of top-notch academic programs aimed at empowering, inspiring, and revolutionizing the next generation of leaders. The research programs are offered in the fields of Law, Humanities, Education, Engineering, Built Environment and IT, Health Science, Veterinary Science, Economics and Management Science, Natural and Agricultural Sciences, and Theology and Religion.
The devoted academic instructors are passionate educators who are motivated to help students succeed in their careers. The purpose of academic programs is to support the passion of researchers and direct them toward a prosperous and opportunity-filled future. The Commonwealth scholarship program for international students is ideal for those aiming to enhance their academic careers and seeking a rewarding academic experience. Apply now before the deadline approaches.
Deadline: The last date to apply is11thSeptember, 2024.

Title: Mastercard Foundation Scholarship at University of Pretoria | Fully Funded
Description:
There is an exciting opportunity for students looking for a chance to pursue their higher studies at the top university in South Africa. The Mastercard Foundation Scholarship at the University of Pretoria is an incredible opportunity for passionate students who are willing to pursue their academic dreams in a world-class institute. These fully-fundedscholarships for African studentsaim to empower young African leaders by providing them with the necessary resources and support to achieve their goals. The program is open to students from all over Africa who possess academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to positively impacting their communities. As an awardee of this prestigious scholarship, you will have access to world-class education and training, mentorship, and networking opportunities. This article is your comprehensive guide to the Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program, outlining the eligibility requirements, benefits, and step-by-step application process. So, make sure to read till the end.
The Mastercard Foundation is a global initiative that aims to transform social and economic conditions by educating and developing the next generation of leaders. The foundation aims to support students from underprivileged backgrounds who show academic excellence and leadership potential. This program is an initiative that provides complete support to young people and passionate students and learning opportunities. The program is designed to equip students with the knowledge, skills, and values needed to succeed in the economy and make positive impacts in the real world. So, students who get this international scholarship will have the opportunity to continue their postgraduate studies without facing any financial difficulties.
The University of Pretoria has teamed up with the Mastercard Foundation to provide scholarships for outstanding African students who want to pursue their higher studies. As a recipient of this scholarship, you will have the chance to study at one of the top universities in Africa and gain valuable skills that will prepare you for a successful career. The scholarship covers almost everything from tuition fees, to medical insurance, and airfare. Upon graduation, students are required to return to their home countries and give back to their communities. This MCFS program is a great opportunity for African students who wish to make a significant difference in their communities and contribute to the continent’s transformation.
This fully funded African Scholarship at the University of Pretoria is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity that students should not miss. Thisinternational scholarshipprovides an array of opportunities, such as access to world-class education and training, mentorship, and networking, to empower young African leaders and help them achieve their goals. The Mastercard Foundation Scholarship is more than just a financial aid program. It aims to empower young African leaders by equipping them with the necessary skills and support to make a positive impact in their respective societies. Therefore, if you are a student who demonstrates academic excellence, leadership qualities, and a commitment to making a difference, then you should apply for this scholarship as soon as possible. Apply now and take the first step toward a brighter future.
Deadline:
The deadline to submit the application is30th August 2023.
Apply NowOfficial Link

African Nationality:
Candidates must be African nationals.

Title: MINDS Scholarship for African Students 2022-2023 | Fully Funded
Description:
MINDS Scholarship program is an outstanding chance to bring a positive change to the whole continent of Africa. The MINDSfully funded scholarshipaims at attracting young leaders who are motivated and committed to facilitating the African Countries in better cooperation in achieving a successful and brighter future. Thetop scholarshipin Africa invites students from all over the continent to study in a foreign country free of cost and learn about the diversity of cultures in Africa. For this purpose, the students are given the chance to interact with native communities which is imperative to acquire knowledge about the richness of their norms.
The MINDS Scholarship Programme for Leadership Development is the opportunity to get improved education and to build networks with like-minded people from all over the African Continent. Moreover, the platform which this scholarship for young leaders provides broadens the vision of the students and brings them into the pool of multi-talented people who are critical thinkers and full of innovative ideas. The core mission behind such an excellent scholarship program is to lead Africa on the path of progress through education, networking, and innovation.
MINDS Scholarship for African students serves as a key to opening new vistas of success for the African Youth. The program has been started in 2017 and since then it is successfully training young leaders who have the minds to make a continent-wide difference through their ideas and work. The program also serves as a sticking force between the African countries because it provides the probable prospects to the students of different countries to have an understanding of each other. Resultantly, peace and cooperation are promoted along with the acceptance of other cultures and ethnicities.
In this fully-fundedMasters’s scholarship, the programs are tailored in a way that they include multiple educational and extracurricular activities. This young leader’s scholarship is the testimony of MINDS’ vision to bring democracy to African societies along with economic prosperity, social inclusiveness, and to attain a rightful place for Africa in the Global community. By providing fully-funded scholarships for the African student MINDS basically provides the forums for dialogues, information dissemination, and networking; which helps in shaping the policy for the future governance of the youth of today as the leader of tomorrow.
Deadline: Deadline is not given on the official website. Apply as soon as possible.
Eligibility: The candidate must be a national of an African country and must be residing in any African country.The candidate must have applied for full-time studies of a one or two-year Honors or Masters.The candidate must have been formally accepted by one or more MINDS preferred institutions or institutions outside of their country of citizenship or residency within the following year.The candidate must have obtained at least 70% in each subject or course in the last two completed years of study.The candidates have to be able to produce evidence of demonstrated leadership abilities or potential guided by the questions and requirements set out in the application form.MINDS encourages applicants to consider universities that are outside of South Africa.

Title: East African Community Scholarship 2021-22 | EAC Scholarship | Fully Funded
Description:
The Inter-University Council for East Africa (IUCEA) invites motivated, qualified, and talented citizens of the East African Community for the EAC Scholarship. The East African Community Scholarship 2021-22 is afully-funded scholarship program for master’s students. The goal of this master’s degree scholarship is to train the young leaders that will help in strengthening regional cooperation among the EAC partner states.
The EAC Scholarship Program was launched by the Federal Republic of Germany and the East African Community. The project was initiated by the mutual understanding of the EAC Secretariat and Inter-University Council for East Africa (IUCEA) with KfW (German Development Bank). The aim of this scholarship program is to create future young leaders which work together for the better future of the East African Community region.
The duration of the KfW- funded Scholarships for African students is two years. The students must have an admission offer for the master’s degree program from the universities of EAC partner state other than their home universities. A total of 63 scholarships are available for the academic year 2021-2022 under the East Africa scholarship program for EAC students.
The EAC scholarship project offers many benefits to the students includingfully-funded scholarshipsfor master’s degrees, internships, leadership training, capacity building, networking, and mentoring. Therefore, it is a great chance for the EAC students to complete their studies without any financial burden and to contribute to their regions.  Individuals with any kind of disability and women from these regions are highly welcomed to apply. There are many other benefits of the KfW scholarship program which are further discussed in the given paragraphs.
Deadline:
The application deadline for the EAST African Community (EAC) Scholarship program isSeptember 17th, 2021.
Apply NowOfficial Link
Eligibility: The candidate must be a citizen of the partner state of the East African Community.The candidates must be below 35 years of age at the time of applying for the scholarship.The applicant must have an equivalent of Upper Second-Class Honours or  “Distinction”.The candidates must have secured admission in any other partner state of the EAC region. The university must not be in its home region.The candidate must submit a motivation letter with the application. The motivation letter must be n English.
